result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A. Spek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew A. Spek is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew A. Spek was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent w/21CF131.
Credit for 25 days served if revoked.
P&P may petition for early discharge after 1/2 probation served successfully.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  No THC.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Probation & Parole to notify the court, in writing upon dirty UA or proof of possession/consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew A. Spek

defendant.name: Spek, Matthew A.
defendant.address: 720 South Cogswell Drive #210, Silver Lake, WI 53170

records.addlTxt: Deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge.

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Rose.  Clerk/H. Barnett. On State's motion, cts 1, 3 & 4 are dismissed. Deft pleads guilty. Court finds deft guilty. Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years, concurrent w/21CF131; credit for 25 days served if revoked; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge. P&P may petition for early discharge after 1/2 probation served successfully.
With ADA Gaertner and Atty Rose the JPTC of 5/13/22 at 9:30am is reset to 3/31/22 at 2:30pm.

Defendant, Matthew A. Spek, appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose. Defendant in custody.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
